resources.description: Maps produced in scope of this Copernicus EMS Risk and Recovery Mapping activation downloadable as georeferenced PDFs, TIFFs and JPEGs together with relevant geodatabase (GDB) and complete final report as well.
resources.name: Copernicus EMS Risk and Recovery Mapping Activation [EMSN035]: Economic impact of floods on agriculture sector in Centre-Val de Loire region, France (2017-05-08)

name: 54d2baa3-e89a-4d61-9c13-e469047e3c1b
description:
Activation date: 2017-05-08
Event type: Flood

Activation reason:
Service Request: Help assess the impact of the May-June 2016 flooding, through post-disaster situation analyses, on the agricultural sector within the vast Centre – Val-de-Loire area of interest. During the episode some areas experienced the worst flooding in 100 years. The activation covers mapping the event, damage grading and economic impact focusing on agriculture sector to provide direct support in public policy implementation by the Ministry of Agriculture.Proposed solution and results:Model maximum flood extent and flood water depths using EO satellite coverage of the event and Digital Terrain/Surface models.Production of a detailed land use/land cover map to derive an impact analysis, adapted from Theia OSO classification 2016 and using French IGN RGE and European Settlement LayersAssessment of the potential impact on population (INSEE data) and crops using data on farmer declarations (2016)Estimate of economic impact on the main annual crops, using farmer declarations, official production statistics and market prices related to 2016 crops     Maximum flood extent and flood water depthsLand use impact analysis      Agricultural economic impact
title: Economic impact of floods on agriculture sector in Centre-Val de Loire region, France (2017-05-08)
